etymology.description: Pictogram: Depicts a pestle (modern 杵(杵) (chǔ, "pestle")) -> original meaning unrelated to time concepts
etymology.interpretation: 午(午) (wǔ, "noon") originally depicted a pestle, but over time it was borrowed for usage in the context of time. Despite its current association with noon, its visual origin is agricultural, related to pounding or grinding.

examples.chinese: 中午时分(中午時分)，阳光灿烂(陽光燦爛)。
examples.english: At noon, the sunlight is brilliant.

examples.chinese: 我在午休中(我在午休中)，享受宁静(享受寧靜)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài wǔxiū zhōng, xiǎngshòu níngjìng.
examples.english: I enjoy tranquility during my noon break.

examples.chinese: 午餐后(午餐後)，公园里热闹非凡(公園裡熱鬧非凡)。
examples.pinyin: Wǔcān hòu, gōngyuán lǐ rènào fēifán.
examples.english: After lunch, the park is bustling.
